Cultural Competency

Objectives

  1. Define the following terms:
    • patient centeredness - see through the patient's eyes
    • culture - the distinct way people live
    • stereotyping - the assumption that all people frmo a given group are the same
    • cultural competence - effectively understanding and appreciating the differences between cultures
  2. List/identify the five characteristics of individual cultural competence.
    • understanding the meaning of culture
    • knowledge about different cultures
    • appreciate diversity
    • aware of health disparities and discrimination affecting minority groups
    • effectively use interpreter services when needed
  3. State the US healthcare system cultural beliefs for each of the following:
    Issue Description
    time perception and management time is valued highly and schedules are strictly adhered
    perceptions of space, eye contact, touch, and gestures respect the patients personal space, maintain eye contact, limit social contact, and understand appropriate gestures
    cause of illness hygiene, environments, and unsafe practice can cause ilnesses
    spiritual role in healing accepted as possible, but not used as a tool in treatment
    role of medications treatment to improve lifestyle
    lines of authority ultimately it is the patient in charge of the final decision
    pain beliefs pain is the worst enemy
    disease perception diseases are bad and must be maintained
    role of nutrition nutrition is used to treat some diseases, but not a primary cure or treatment
    access to healthcare everybody has access to healthcare in the US, but this is false in other cultures
  4. List the four components of Betendcourt ESFT patient-based model of cultural competency and identify the questions Betencourt suggests that pharmacists ask for each of the four components.
    Model Component Questions to ask patients
    Explanatory What do you think caused your problem? Why do you think it started when it did? How does it affect you? What worries you most? What kind of treatment do you think you should receive?
    Social How do you get your medications? Are they difficult to afford? Do you have time to pick them up? How quickly do you get them? Do you have help getting them?
    Fear Are you concerned with the design, color, or size of the pills? Have you heard anything about this medication? Are you worried about the side effects?
    Treatment Do you understand how to take this medication? Can you tell me how you will take it?
